founding_conditions.capital: Access to up to $15M via venture/angel capital if the opportunity is clean. $8-10M readily accessible; up to $15M for compelling physical/production plays. VC/angel appetite confirmed shifting toward hard-tech/robotics/physical-economy (a16z American Dynamism, BlackRock overweight industrials, JPM supercycle broadening, Goldman $500B+ AI capex).
founding_conditions.team: 2 founders -- ML/AI Masters (Georgia Tech) + operator (Argentina native, US resident)
founding_conditions.location: Davis CA -- 1hr from SF, direct access to UC Davis ag robotics ecosystem, Central Valley specialty crop growers, CA food production cluster
founding_conditions.markets: US + LATAM lowest friction, any geography viable on economics

current.name: 5-Axis Structural Durability Scoring (Cycle 6+, stress-tested Cycle 7)

economic_force_magnitude.description: TAM x cost advantage ratio x Jevons expansion potential

structural_compounding.description: Does business get HARDER to compete with over time?

convergence_resistance.description: What prevents competitors from replicating in 3 years?

capital_efficiency.description: Structural advantage gained per dollar invested

current.stress_test_validation: Cycle 7 tested 3 alternative weight vectors (force-dominant, compounding-dominant, convergence-dominant). 7 of top 10 models robust across ALL vectors. Architecture dominance partially weight-dependent: physical dominates convergence/compounding, data compounding dominates force.

history.weights: balanced 1.0 across: competitive_density, unit_economics_clarity, distribution_specificity, moat_durability, customer_findability
history.reason: v2 cycles 0-4 used balanced weights on sector-level scoring.

history.weights: balanced 1.0 across: competitive_density, unit_economics_clarity, distribution_specificity, moat_durability, customer_findability
history.reason: YC-granularity decomposition. Customer-segment-based scoring. PROBLEM: scored tactical accessibility, not structural durability.

history.weights: weighted: economic_force (35%), structural_compounding (25%), convergence_resistance (20%), timing_structural_fit (10%), capital_efficiency (10%)
history.reason: Architecture-based decomposition. CORRECTS Cycle 5: scores STRUCTURAL DURABILITY. Physical architectures dominate because convergence resistance from physical assets >> software.

history.weights: Same as cycle 6 (validated by stress test)
history.reason: NAICS-systematic expansion + stress test. 3 alternative weight vectors tested. Core weights VALIDATED: 7 of top 10 robust across all vectors. Key finding: physical vs digital dominance is partially weight-dependent, not absolute.

acquire_and_modernize.description: Buy existing business at demographic-distress pricing, deploy AI+robotics. Highest convergence resistance. PC8 adds: auto repair (86K estabs), beauty salon, commercial equipment repair, electronic repair, auto body/collision, plumbing/HVAC, cleaning, pest control, specialty trade construction.

rollup_consolidation.description: Acquire-and-modernize at scale. Strongest compounding mechanism. PC8 adds: auto repair multi-shop, landscaping multi-territory, elder care 925K estabs, heavy civil construction.

data_compounding.description: Service entry + data flywheel. Weak at year 1, unassailable at year 5. PC8 adds: auto repair intelligence, wholesale trade intelligence, property operations, equipment reliability, elder care, freight specialty, hotel revenue, food distribution, real estate transaction, auto parts.

full_service_replacement.description: Replace entire function (not just sell a tool). Christensen disruptive layer. PC8 adds: wholesale brokerage, medical equipment distribution, property management, landscaping ops, hospital ops, engineering services, motion picture, marketing agency, PR, talent management, hotel ops, elder care, construction ops, legal ops, cybersecurity, workforce transition, + 14 AI-supercharged practice models.

regulatory_moat_builder.description: Build compliance infrastructure. Every new regulation increases value. PC8 adds: Fair Housing compliance, elder care multi-state Medicaid, AI compliance-as-a-service cross-industry.

platform_infrastructure.description: Build once, sell many. Moderate convergence resistance. PC8 adds: landscaping AI ops, warehouse AI ops, self-storage, beauty/salon, insurance agency infra, community banking infra, manufacturing supply chain, grant/incentive capture, elder care agency.

marketplace_network.description: Network effects once at critical mass. Binary value. PC8 adds: B2B wholesale marketplace, towing dispatch network.

arbitrage_window.description: Time-limited structural mispricing. Act during PE distress window. PC8 adds: distressed media properties (local news revival), dead travel agency revival, photo/video post-production revival.

physical_production_ai.description: Greenfield AI-native production. Lower than acquire-and-modernize (no inherited moats). Unchanged from C7.

vertical_saas.description: LOWEST score. Easy to start but hard to defend. Platform incumbents can add features. No new models added — pattern confirmed.

top_20_models.name: Full-Service AI Finance Function for SMBs
AI Ops Platform for Building Equipment Contractors
Insurance AI Compliance + Bias Auditing Platform
Acquire + Modernize Plastics Injection Molding Shop
Full-Service AI Practice Operations for Allied Health

key_discoveries: NAICS 624120 Elder Care: 925K establishments = MOST FRAGMENTED sector in entire US economy, 2.23M employees, demographic demand guaranteed
NAICS 561730 Landscaping: 122K establishments, only 17% AI adoption, ZERO competitive startup activity, BizBuySell prices up 20%
NAICS 425120 Wholesale Brokers: 122K establishments, Baumol 1.73x, ZERO AI startup activity — nobody has even tried
NAICS 811111 Auto Repair: 86K establishments, 68K technician shortage annually through 2033, Silver Tsunami in shop ownership
AI Beneficiaries dimension: 14 models of AI-supercharged traditional practices (CPA+AI, lawyer+AI, engineer+AI) — don't sell tools, BE the firm
External research confirms: wholesale distribution, landscaping, medical equipment distribution have LOWEST competitive density AND strongest structural forces = Schumpeterian gap

running_patterns.description: Multi-Sector Baumol Cure Convergence: Healthcare, legal, accounting, insurance all releasing stored above-CPI energy simultaneously
running_patterns.cycle_7_update: NAICS data quantifies depth: $207B automatable wages across 7 key occupations. Baumol force produces models across 8 of 10 architecture types. NAICS 5613 (staffing) declining 7.6% = ACTIVE cascade. NAICS 5223 (credit intermediation support) declining 10.7% with wages up 13.8% = textbook Schumpeterian gap.

running_patterns.description: Demographic Gap + AI Readiness Convergence
running_patterns.cycle_7_update: NAICS systematic scan reveals 12+ manufacturing sectors with retiring owners beyond CNC and food: printing (28K estabs), plastics (12K), furniture (12.7K), metal fab, coating, foundry, rubber, glass, paper, sawmill. Acquire-and-modernize architecture extends across all these sectors.

running_patterns.description: Regulatory Fragmentation as Structural Moat
running_patterns.cycle_7_update: NAICS reveals new regulatory moat opportunities: veterinary (state corporate practice laws), child care (50-state licensing), construction permitting (jurisdictional fragmentation), dental (FTC scrutiny of PE), financial AI (multi-regulator compliance). 5 new regulatory moat builder models added.

running_patterns.description: Jevons Expansion 3-5x in Professional Services
running_patterns.cycle_7_update: Confirmed across NAICS data. Building trades (NAICS 2382): 499K new workers needed = massive unmet demand. Allied health (NAICS 6213): employment growing 6.8%, most fragmented healthcare sector (191K establishments). Jevons expansion applies to services AND to physical production (lower cost = more accessible custom manufacturing).

running_patterns.description: Robotics x AI Compound Production Cost Compression
running_patterns.cycle_7_update: NAICS-driven expansion adds 12+ new manufacturing sectors for cobot deployment: printing (28K estabs, 85% say AI critical), plastics injection molding (robotic part removal proven), furniture (AI design-to-CNC), metal fabrication, auto parts, foundry, coating/heat treating. $2.26B Q1 2026 robotics funding validates continued investment appetite.

running_patterns.description: Christensen Three-Layer Competitive Framework
running_patterns.cycle_7_update: Stress test validates: full-service replacement (78 avg) consistently outscores vertical SaaS (62 avg) across ALL weight vectors. The 16-point gap is structural and weight-independent.

running_patterns.description: Dead Business Revival at AI-Native Cost Structure
running_patterns.cycle_7_update: Pattern extended beyond accounting: PE-distressed veterinary, dental, and staffing practices now available for AI-native revival. Combined validated market failures >$1B. NAICS 5613 staffing employment declining 7.6% = active Schumpeterian destruction creating revival opportunities.

running_patterns.description: Physical Architecture Dominance Over Digital
running_patterns.cycle_7_update: STRESS TEST NUANCE: Physical dominance is PARTIALLY weight-dependent. Physical architectures dominate under convergence-dominant (86.4 avg) and compounding-dominant (86.1 avg) weights. But data compounding (digital) takes #1 position under force-dominant weights (88.1 avg). CONCLUSION: physical is MORE DURABLE, digital captures MORE ECONOMIC FORCE. Strategy implication UNCHANGED: start physical for durability, build digital for scale.

running_patterns.description: Data Compounding as Bridge to Unassailability
running_patterns.cycle_7_update: UPGRADED from strong. Stress test confirms: data compounding models score #1 under force-dominant weights. C7-DC-FIN-01 (87) and C7-DC-HC-01 (85) remain top 10 across ALL weight vectors. New data compounding models added: trades intelligence, insurance claims, workforce, construction, legal, veterinary.

running_patterns.description: Timing for Physical, Compounding for Digital
running_patterns.cycle_7_update: UPGRADED from strong. NAICS data deepens: printing, plastics, furniture, metal fab ALL have retiring owners (timing windows). Data compounding models ALL have multi-year flywheel designs. The dual strategy is validated across 12+ manufacturing sectors and 7+ data compounding plays.

running_patterns.description: NEW: NAICS-Driven Systematic Sector Discovery
running_patterns.detail: Systematic NAICS QCEW screening (293 4-digit industries, 933 6-digit sub-industries) reveals sectors invisible to top-down analysis. PRINTING (NAICS 3231): 28K establishments = highest manufacturing fragmentation, totally unexplored before C7. BUILDING EQUIPMENT CONTRACTORS (NAICS 2382): 2.46M employees, 70% can't find workers = massive Baumol/Jevons opportunity. EMPLOYMENT SERVICES (NAICS 5613): 3.57M employees declining 7.6% = active cascade. ALLIED HEALTH (NAICS 6213): 191K establishments = most fragmented healthcare. Bottom-up NAICS scanning produces higher-quality discoveries than top-down theme scanning.

running_patterns.description: NEW: Stress Test Reveals Weight-Conditional Architecture Rankings
running_patterns.detail: The physical > digital architecture dominance from Cycle 6 is PARTIALLY weight-dependent. Under convergence-dominant weights, physical (86.4) dominates. Under force-dominant weights, data compounding (88.1) dominates. 7 of top 10 models are ROBUST across all 3 alternative vectors: C6-RC-MFG-01, C6-AM-MFG-01, C6-DC-FIN-01, C6-RMB-HC-01, C6-AM-FOOD-01, C6-DC-HC-01, C6-FSR-HC-01. Weight-SENSITIVE models: C6-FSR-FIN-01 (force-dependent), C6-RC-FOOD-01 (compounding-dependent), C6-AW-ACC-01 (timing-dependent).

running_patterns.description: NEW: PE Distress Cascade Extending to New Sectors
running_patterns.detail: PE rollup distress now visible beyond accounting: veterinary (saturation + FTC scrutiny + regulatory backlash), dental (137 PE acquisitions in 2024 but rising valuations squeezing returns), staffing (employment declining 7.6%), printing (secular digital decline stressing PE print companies). Counter-PE strategy (acquire at 3-5x EBITDA vs PE-paid 8-12x, operate with AI cost structure PE can't match) applies across multiple sectors.

running_patterns.description: NEW: Zero-Competitive-Density Schumpeterian Gaps
running_patterns.detail: External research reveals sectors where ZERO AI startups have attempted entry despite strong structural forces. Wholesale distribution (1,197 BizBuySell listings, zero YC activity, zero startup failures because nobody tried), landscaping (700K businesses, 17% AI adoption, zero AI startup activity), medical equipment distribution (zero targeted AI startups). These are not SATURATED sectors where everyone failed — they are INVISIBLE sectors that AI entrepreneurs haven't noticed yet. The engine's NAICS bottom-up screening is the first systematic method to identify these gaps.

running_patterns.description: NEW: AI Beneficiary = BE the Firm, Don't Sell the Tool
running_patterns.detail: New dimension of opportunity: instead of selling AI tools TO accountants/lawyers/engineers, BE an AI-supercharged accounting/law/engineering firm. 1 professional + AI handles workload of 5-10 person traditional firm. Price at 40-50% of traditional. Competitive advantage: Coasean firm shrinkage means optimal firm size is now 1-3 people + AI. Licensed professions (CPA, PE, PLS, attorney) provide regulatory moat. 14 models constructed across accounting, law, insurance, veterinary, architecture, engineering, surveying, tax prep, construction management, inspection, physical therapy, pharmacy, mortgage. CA AB 1175 (Jan 2027) lowering CPA requirements validates trend.

running_patterns.description: NEW: Elder Care = Largest Fragmentation + Strongest Demographic Demand
running_patterns.detail: NAICS 624120 (Services for elderly/disabled): 2.23M employees, 925K establishments = MOST FRAGMENTED sector in the entire US economy by establishment count. $26K avg pay = lowest major sector. 65+ population growing 3%/year = structural demand guarantee. 50-state Medicaid billing + EVV requirements = regulatory moat opportunity. 6 models constructed across all architecture types. This sector was entirely missed by top-down theme scanning — only found through NAICS systematic screening.

running_patterns.description: NEW: BizBuySell Confirms Acquisition Market Depth
running_patterns.detail: BizBuySell data confirms acquisition market viability for acquire-and-modernize strategy: 72% of brokers expect MORE owners in 2026 (Boomer retirements). Landscaping prices up 20% in 2025. Wholesale distribution: 1,197 listings, median price dropped 41% in 2025 (entry point). Auto repair: deep market, closing price gaps. Buyers explicitly favoring essential services (HVAC, plumbing, landscaping) as recession-resilient. 49% of brokers say Boomers already majority of listings. This validates acquire-and-modernize as the dominant architecture.

running_patterns.description: NEW: Financial Services Cascade CONFIRMED and ACCELERATING
running_patterns.detail: Multi-source cross-referencing confirms active Schumpeterian destruction in financial services. BLS: accounting employment DOWN 49K YoY. FRED: business loan delinquency rising to 1.78%. YFinance: Financials ETF dead last among all sectors at +0.5% (6mo). EDGAR: 10K+ restructuring filings, 3,808 AI-as-risk-factor 10-Ks. Census CBP: 974K professional service establishments, $1.07T payroll. This is not a prediction — it is HAPPENING. 7 independent data sources confirm. AI Financial Intelligence Platform (C7-DC-FIN-01) promoted to #1 overall at score 90.

running_patterns.description: NEW: Staffing Canary = Strongest Real-Time Market Signal
running_patterns.detail: Three major staffing stocks in freefall while broad market is up. RHI (Robert Half) -53.1%, MAN (ManpowerGroup) -43.9%, KELYA (Kelly Services) -25.4% in one year. This EXCEEDS the signal strength of the accounting cascade. Combined with BLS showing staffing employment -7.6% and QCEW showing $192.7B wages in NAICS 5613 = active, confirmed Schumpeterian destruction. Staffing models jumped +4 each: FSR-STAFF-01 from rank 21 to 13, AW-STAFF-01 from rank 35 to 20. Staffing stocks lead BLS data by 1-3 months = expect further employment decline.

running_patterns.description: NEW: Auto Repair Competitive Density Invalidates Zero-Density Assumption
running_patterns.detail: Pre-cycle 8 assumed auto repair was zero-density Schumpeterian gap. Cycle 8 web search discovered: Revv raised $20M specifically for AI auto repair, ADAS diagnostics provider also funded $20M+. Total funded competitors: 5. Auto repair models downgraded -4 (PC8-AM-AUTO-01: 79→75, PC8-RC-AUTO-01: 80→76). LESSON: competitive density must be VERIFIED by web search before assuming zero-density. Validates cycle 8 methodology of cross-referencing all models with competitive landscape search.

opportunity_landscape.summary: Cycle 8: Multi-source cross-referencing across 7 data source types (FRED, BLS, EDGAR, YFinance, Census CBP, Web Search, QCEW). 70+ connector methods activated. Top 20 models cross-referenced against 3-7 independent data sources each. KEY FINDINGS: (1) Financial Services Cascade CONFIRMED and ACCELERATING — BLS: accounting employment down 49K YoY, FRED: business loan delinquency rising to 1.78%, YFinance: financials ETF dead last at +0.5%. AI Financial Intelligence Platform now #1 (score 90). (2) Staffing Industry Destruction = STRONGEST market signal — RHI -53%, MAN -44%, KELYA -25% in 1 year. Staffing models jumped +4 each. (3) Physical production sectors CONFIRMED — Industrials +15.1%, Materials +20.1% ETF performance. Manufacturing models maintain top rankings. (4) Zero-density gaps VALIDATED — web search confirms ZERO funded startups in wholesale distribution, commercial printing, specialty food. (5) Auto repair COMPETITIVE — Revv $20M, ADAS $20M+. Auto repair models downgraded -4. (6) AI infrastructure capex peaking — NVIDIA flat, MSFT -24%. Application layer (our models) benefits. (7) Business formation 532K/mo = Coasean shrinkage confirmed. 17 models upgraded, 2 downgraded, 21 unchanged.

key_unknowns: Customer discovery interviews -- STILL TOP PRIORITY. No actual conversations in any cycle. Talk to: (a) retiring CNC/printing/food production owners, (b) SMB owners doing own bookkeeping, (c) independent healthcare practices about prior auth pain, (d) HVAC/plumbing contractors about workforce challenges, (e) allied health practitioners about billing pain.
SBA 504 CDC relationship establishment -- TIME SENSITIVE before Sept 2026 deadline.
BizBuySell specific acquisition targets -- narrow to 5-10 CNC shops, 5-10 food producers, 5-10 print shops with criteria.
Cobot integration partner in CA -- Standard Bots vs UR vs FANUC for specific shop configurations.
Data compounding feasibility -- can aggregated SMB financial data be productized while maintaining privacy?
Regulatory moat builder competitive landscape -- any funded players specifically building multi-state healthcare/insurance/veterinary AI compliance?
PE distress timeline -- when do first forced sales from $1.2T maturity wall appear in accounting, dental, veterinary, staffing?
Printing industry acquisition targets -- what % of 28K print shops are viable acquisition candidates (growing segments vs declining)?
Building trades AI adoption rate -- what % of 230K building equipment contractor establishments have adopted any AI/scheduling tools?
Allied health practice billing costs -- quantify the per-practice cost of billing/admin as % of revenue for PT, chiro, optometry, speech.
Plastics injection molding cobot readiness -- which specific robotic cells are proven for injection molding shops?
Dental PE distress timing -- when do FTC actions and rising valuations force PE dental exits?
next_cycle_suggestions: PRIORITY 1: Customer discovery interviews -- 10+ conversations across top 5 opportunities (CNC shop owners, food producers, SMB bookkeeping, healthcare practices, building contractors).
PRIORITY 2: SBA 504 CDC relationship -- contact Statewide CDC, model capital stacks for printing and plastics acquisitions (in addition to CNC and food).
PRIORITY 3: Narrow BizBuySell acquisition targets to 5-10 per sector: CNC, food, printing, plastics, furniture.

PRIORITY 4: Deep-dive on NAICS-discovered sectors: commercial printing (28K estabs -- what segments are growing?), building trades (2.46M workers -- AI adoption landscape?), allied health (191K estabs -- billing pain quantification?).
PRIORITY 5: Stress test NEW cycle 7 top 10 models with real competitive intelligence (web search for competitors per model).
PRIORITY 6: Architecture sequencing plan: map optimal order of physical acquisitions + parallel digital data compounding builds.
PRIORITY 7: Build prototype specification for #1 or #2 opportunity (CNC rollup or financial intelligence platform).
